column3: Ctrl+F2, then F (requires full keyboard access active, using System Preferences > Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > Full Keyboard Access > All Controls. Alternatively use Ctrl+F1 to toggle this setting.)
Ctrl+⇧Shift+Eject or MBR Ctrl+⇧Shift+Pwr (If "Require password after sleep or screen saver" is enabled in "System Preferences — Security & Privacy")

column2: ⊞Win+D or ⊞Win+M (then use ⊞Win+⇧Shift+M to bring back all windows)
⊞Win, enter executable name or ⊞Win+R, enter executable name

column1: Save screenshot of entire screen as file
column4: Print Screen set the name and click "Save".

column1: Copy screenshot of entire screen to clipboard
Save screenshot of window as file
column4: Alt+Print Screen set the name and click "Save". GNOME

column1: Copy screenshot of window to clipboard
column4: Alt+Print Screen click "Copy to Clipboard". GNOME

column1: Delete char to the right of cursor
Delete word to the right of cursor
Delete word to the left of cursor
Move the cursor down the length of the viewport
Move the cursor up the length of the viewport
Go up one level in the navigation hierarchy
